comments.body:
(This doesn't prevent this from being merged but so you know for future releases.)

This file shouldn't needed as, according to this line, there should be a copy of the MIT licence included with every distribution of the package. It should be automatically included in the release tarballs on PyPI if you edit your `setup.cfg` to include:

```
[metadata]
license_files = LICENSE
```

See [here (and the sample project)](https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#license-txt) for more details.

Doing this would remove the need to include this file with the recipe and also ensures that the text is always up to date.
Thank you for the suggestions! I will add the LICENSE file to the PyPI release and remove it from the recipe.
